# Bibliography: Sedenion Physics, Modular Entropy, and Noncommutative Geometry

**Date:** January 26, 2026
**Curator:** Gemini CLI

This document compiles primary sources identifying the intersection of Sedenion algebra, Zero Divisors, and Modular Entropy in Quantum Gravity contexts.

## 1. Sedenion Geometry & Zero Divisors (16D)

*   **Koebisu, Shoot (2025).** *Singular structures and geometric holonomy in the zero divisor set of the sedenions.* arXiv:2512.13002 [math.DG].
    *   **Significance:** Rigorously maps Sedenion zero divisors to the Stiefel manifold $V_2(\mathbb{R}^8)$ and analyzes geometric holonomy. Defines the "zero divisor frame bundle."
    *   **Link:** [arXiv:2512.13002](https://arxiv.org/abs/2512.13002)

*   **Reggiani, Silvio (2024).** *The geometry of sedenion zero divisors.* arXiv:2411.18881 [math.DG].
    *   **Significance:** Proves the zero divisor manifold $\mathcal{Z}(\mathbb{S})$ is isometric to the exceptional Lie group $G_2$ with a specific metric. This provides a direct link between 16D algebra and $G_2$ symmetry (crucial for M-theory).
    *   **Link:** [arXiv:2411.18881](https://arxiv.org/abs/2411.18881)

*   **Wilmot, G. P. (2025).** *Structure of the Cayley-Dickson algebras.* arXiv:2505.11747 [math.RA].
    *   **Significance:** Classifies non-associativity types and zero divisor patterns, specifically identifying "3-cycles" and "modes" that reduce the set of 84 zero divisors to 7 fundamental modes.
    *   **Link:** [arXiv:2505.11747](https://arxiv.org/abs/2505.11747)

*   **de Marrais, Robert P. C. (2000).** *The 42 Assessors and the Box-Kites they fly: Diagonal Axis-Pair Systems of Zero-Divisors in the Sedenions' 16 Dimensions.* arXiv:math/0011260 [math.GM].
    *   **Significance:** The foundational paper identifying the "Box-Kite" lattice structure of zero divisors, establishing the discrete combinatorial geometry underlying the continuous manifolds.
    *   **Link:** [arXiv:math/0011260](https://arxiv.org/abs/math/0011260)

*   **de Marrais, Robert P. C. (2002).** *Flying Higher Than a Box-Kite: Kite-Chain Middens... in the 2n-ions Beyond the Sedenions.* arXiv:math/0207003.
    *   **Significance:** Extends the zero-divisor analysis to 32D (Pathions) and 64D (Chingons), predicting "Kite-Chain Middens" which aligns with our project's "Hyper-Web" findings.
    *   **Link:** [arXiv:math/0207003](https://arxiv.org/abs/math/0207003)

## 2. Physics Applications of Sedenions

*   **Weng, Zi-Hua (2018).** *Four interactions in the sedenion curved spaces.* arXiv:1812.02535 [physics.gen-ph].
    *   **Significance:** Attempts to formulate field equations for fundamental interactions using complex-sedenions in curved space, proposing that spatial parameters influence divergence/curl operators.
    *   **Link:** [arXiv:1812.02535](https://arxiv.org/abs/1812.02535)

*   **Tang, Qiang & Tang, Jau (2023).** *Sedenion algebra for three lepton/quark generations and its relations to SU(5).* arXiv:2308.14768 [physics.gen-ph].
    *   **Significance:** Uses the subalgebra structure of Sedenions (5 quaternions, 3 octonions) to naturally motivate the three generations of fermions in the Standard Model.
    *   **Link:** [arXiv:2308.14768](https://arxiv.org/abs/2308.14768)

## 3. Modular Entropy & Holography (AdS/CFT)

*   **Yu, Ming-Hui et al. (2025).** *Replica Wormholes, Modular Entropy, and Capacity of Entanglement in JT Gravity.* arXiv:2501.11474 [hep-th].
    *   **Significance:** Analyzes modular entropy evolution in End-of-the-World brane models and Island models. The saturation curves directly resemble our recursive entropy PDE results.
    *   **Link:** [arXiv:2501.11474](https://arxiv.org/abs/2501.11474)

*   **Ren, Jie & Sun, Dao-Quan (2024).** *Holographic supersymmetric Renyi entropies from hyperbolic black holes with scalar hair.* arXiv:2404.05638 [hep-th].
    *   **Significance:** Unifies Renyi entropy formulas for hyperbolic black holes, providing a benchmark for our "Surreal Entropy" scaling comparison.
    *   **Link:** [arXiv:2404.05638](https://arxiv.org/abs/2404.05638)

*   **Hollowood, Timothy J. et al. (2024).** *Replica Renyi Wormholes and Generalised Modular Entropy in JT Gravity.* arXiv:2406.16339 [hep-th].
    *   **Significance:** Connects generalized modular entropy to Quantum Extremal Surfaces (QES), reinforcing the link between modularity and geometric topology in gravity.
    *   **Link:** [arXiv:2406.16339](https://arxiv.org/abs/2406.16339)
